WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder.overlap

Function/Meaning
Overlap count
Type
Property of WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder class (read/write)
Description
Represents the overlap count (oversampling factor).
Specify 0 or a power of 2 between 2 and 32. The default is 0.
If 0 is specified, an appropriate value is set according to the current value of the time property.
Increasing this value improves resolution in the time axis direction. It is recommended to use a higher value especially when slowing down the playback speed.
Increasing the value will result in higher CPU usage.
Changes to this property are reflected in real-time, but due to buffering, it takes about 2 seconds before it is actually played. Also, noise may occur during the transition.
